column2: Amazon VPC Peering allows you to connect two VPCs so that instances in either VPC can communicate with each other using private IP addresses.

column1: How does VPC peering handle network traffic?
column2: VPC peering provides a direct network route using private IP addresses.

column1: Can VPC A communicate with VPC C through VPC B using VPC peering?
column2: No, transitive peering is not supported. Each VPC has a one-to-one peering relationship.

column1: Can you peer VPCs with overlapping CIDR blocks?
column2: No, VPCs with overlapping CIDR blocks can't be peered.

column1: Is it possible to establish a VPC peering connection between VPCs in different regions?
column2: Yes, this is known as inter-region VPC peering.

column1: Can VPCs from different AWS accounts be peered?
column2: Yes, VPC peering can be established between VPCs from the same or different AWS accounts.

column1: How are data transfer costs handled in VPC peering?
column2: Data transferred across VPC peering connections is charged at the standard data transfer rate.
